column1: TA1.3;The Ambient Air Quality Directives set EU air quality standards for 12 air pollutants: sulphur dioxide
column2: nitrogen dioxide / nitrogen oxides
column12: and benzo(a)pyrene.;TA7.9;+;The improvement of air quality as a result of the Ambient Air Quality Directives is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030
column13: as better air quality will lead to fewer premature deaths. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of air quality in reducing premature deaths.

column1: TA1.9;The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62 % compared to 2005 (increasing the linear emissions reduction factor from 2.2 % per year up to 4.4 %);TA7.4;-;The EU ETS target may have a negative impact on the target of reducing by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity
column2: as the increased focus on reducing greenhouse gas emissions might lead to a decrease in efforts to address air pollution. However
column3: this connection is not explicitly stated in the report and requires further analysis.

column1: TA2.1;REPowerEU sets a target of 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen production and 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen imports by 2030.;TA3.10;+;The REPowerEU target is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the share of renewable energy in the energy mix
column2: as renewable hydrogen production and imports will contribute to the overall share of renewable energy. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of renewable energy in achieving a low-carbon economy.

column1: TA2.5;Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and almost 600 GW by 2030;TA7.7;+;The target of bringing online a significant amount of solar photovoltaic capacity is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing waste
column2: as increased renewable energy production will lead to a decrease in waste generation from fossil fuel-based energy production. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of renewable energy in reducing waste.

column1: TA2.9;Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42.5%.;TA1.3;+;The target of increasing the share of renewable energy in the energy mix is likely to have a positive impact on the target of improving air quality
column2: as renewable energy production generates less air pollution compared to fossil fuel-based energy production. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of renewable energy in improving air quality.

column1: TA3.10;ESR;+;The ESR target is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions
column2: as the ESR aims to reduce emissions from sectors not covered by the EU ETS. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA4.1;Achieve an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030;TA2.1;-;The target of achieving a significant amount of sustainable biomethane production may have a negative impact on the target of producing 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen
column2: as the production of biomethane may compete with the production of renewable hydrogen for the same resources. However
column3: this connection is not explicitly stated in the report and requires further analysis.

column1: TA6.47;(trees) When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4
column6: Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030 at Union level.;TA1.12;+;The target of planting additional trees is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use
column7: land use change and forestry sector
column8: as trees absorb CO2 from the atmosphere. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of carbon sequestration.

column1: TA6.48;(forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least six out of seven of the following indicators in forest ecosystems;TA1.12;+;The target of improving forest ecosystem indicators is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal
column2: as healthy forests can sequester more carbon. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of forest ecosystems in carbon sequestration.

column1: TA6.49;(forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index;TA1.12;+;The target of improving the common forest bird index is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal
column2: as a healthy forest bird population can indicate a healthy forest ecosystem. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of biodiversity in forest ecosystems.

column1: TA6.50;Reach no net land take;TA1.8;+;The target of reaching no net land take is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector
column2: as reducing land take can lead to more efficient use of resources
column3: including energy. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of resource efficiency.

column1: TA6.51;Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean;TA1.9;+;The target of ensuring clean drinking water is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing the contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS
column2: as clean water can lead to improved public health
column3: which can in turn lead to increased productivity and reduced greenhouse gas emissions. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of public health in reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA6.62;The Water Reuse Regulation aim to encourage and facilitate water reuse in the EU by harmonised minimum water quality requirements for the safe reuse of treated urban wastewaters in agricultural irrigation;TA2.9;+;The target of encouraging water reuse is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the share of renewable energy
column2: as water reuse can lead to increased energy efficiency and reduced energy consumption. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of energy efficiency.

column1: TA7.4;The Industrial Emissions Directive (IED) aims at preventing or reducing emissions from large industrial installations and intensive farming into the environment.;TA1.3;+;The target of reducing industrial emissions is likely to have a positive impact on the target of improving air quality
column2: as reduced emissions from industrial installations can lead to improved air quality. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of reducing industrial emissions.

column1: TA7.5;The revised Urban Wastewater Treatment Directive (UWWTD) extends the scope of the 1991 UWWTD to improve and maintain access to sanitation for all;TA1.8;+;The target of improving wastewater treatment is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector
column2: as improved wastewater treatment can lead to increased energy efficiency and reduced energy consumption. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of energy efficiency.

column1: TA7.6;Improve soil quality by reducing chemical pesticides’ use by 50%
column2: by 2030;TA1.12;+;The target of reducing chemical pesticides' use is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal
column3: as reduced chemical use can lead to improved soil health and increased carbon sequestration. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of soil health in carbon sequestration.

column1: TA7.8;Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses use by 50%
column2: by 2030;TA1.12;+;The target of reducing nutrient losses is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal
column3: as reduced nutrient losses can lead to improved soil health and increased carbon sequestration. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of soil health in carbon sequestration.

column1: TA7.9;Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030;TA1.3;+;The target of improving air quality is likely to have a positive impact on the target of improving air quality
column2: as reduced air pollution can lead to improved public health and increased productivity. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of air quality in public health.

column1: TA7.10;Improve water quality by reducing waste
column2: plastic litter at sea (by 50%);TA2.9;+;The target of improving water quality is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the share of renewable energy
column3: as improved water quality can lead to increased energy efficiency and reduced energy consumption. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of energy efficiency.

column1: TA7.11;Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%);TA2.9;+;The target of reducing microplastics is likely to have a positive impact on the target of increasing the share of renewable energy
column2: as reduced microplastics can lead to improved water quality and increased energy efficiency. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of energy efficiency.

column1: TA7.13;Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity
column2: by 2030;TA1.3;+;The target of reducing air pollution is likely to have a positive impact on the target of improving air quality
column3: as reduced air pollution can lead to improved biodiversity and ecosystem health. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of air quality in biodiversity.

column1: TA7.14;Reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise by 30%
column2: by 2030;TA2.5;-;The target of reducing transport noise may have a negative impact on the target of bringing online a significant amount of solar photovoltaic capacity
column3: as the reduction of transport noise may lead to increased costs and reduced efficiency in the transportation of solar panels. However
column4: this connection is not explicitly stated in the report and requires further analysis.

column1: TA7.15;Having all soils in healthy condition by 2050;TA1.12;+;The target of achieving healthy soils is likely to have a positive impact on the target of achieving an EU net greenhouse gas removal
column2: as healthy soils can sequester more carbon. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of soil health in carbon sequestration.

column1: TA7.16;By means of an updated and harmonised list of pollutants affecting surface and groundwater
column2: updated existing quality standards
column5: and a more flexible framework for addressing pollutants of emerging concerns;TA1.9;+;The target of improving water quality is likely to have a positive impact on the target of reducing the contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS
column6: as improved water quality can lead to increased productivity and reduced greenhouse gas emissions. This connection is based on the report's emphasis on the importance of public health in reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
